title: Installation issue: metis - metis not building with %nvhpc
body:
When attempting to build metis using %nvhpc the compilation fails due to various minor compilation warnings (e.g. unused
variables, etc), which get promoted to errors because of the  compilation -Werror flag.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install metis@5.1.0%nvhpc
...
"/tmp/spackswinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-metis-5.1.0-3y4wrhkglwd5ekzn2qxtqchhudb4of2c/spack-src/GKlib/fs.c", line 190: error: variable "endptr" was set but never used
    char *endptr, *tmp;
          ^

1 error detected in the compilation of "/tmp/spackswinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-metis-
```
The above is only the first such instance of such an error encountered in the compilation of metis; I found about a dozen files have these and similar errors ( e.g.
* variable "foo" was set but never used
* variable "foo" was declared but never referenced
* statement is unreachable
* enumerated type mixed with another type
)

### Information on your system

```console
$spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2429-f5e6c32495
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-x86_64
* **Concretizer:** original
```

My nvhpc is is @21.5, setup as an external package in Spack, and the compiler definition in Spack adds the flag
'--noswitcherror' to cflags, cxxflags, and fcflags (to reduce the number of failed packages due to nvhpc not recognizing flags gcc and icc recognize).


### Additional information
